greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of positive numbers k <= sigma(n) that are not a sum of any subset of distinct divisors of n.
formula: a(n) = 0 for practical numbers (A005153), a(n) > 0 for numbers that are not practical (A237287).
a(n) = A184387(n) - A229335(n) for numbers n such that A119347(n) = A100587(n).
example: For n = 5, a(5) = 2 + 3 + 4 = 9 (numbers 2, 3 and 4 are not a sum of any subset of distinct divisors of 5).
Numbers n = 14 and 15 are an interesting pair of consecutive numbers with identical value of sigma(n) such that simultaneously a(14) = a(15) and A237290(14) = A237290(15).
maple: for k from 1 to numtheory[sigma](n) do
mathematica: a[n_] := Block[{d = Divisors@n, s}, s = Plus @@ d; s*(s + 1)/2 - Plus @@ Union[Plus @@@ Subsets@d]]; m = Array[a, 59] (* _Giovanni Resta_, Mar 13 2014 *)
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Mar 02 2014
ext: a(55) and a(57)-a(59) corrected by _Giovanni Resta_, Mar 13 2014
